states.description: An empty ceramic cup sits on a wooden table. Next to it is a dry tea bag in its paper wrapper, and a cold, unplugged electric kettle.
The kettle is filled with water and plugged in. The water is beginning to boil, and steam is visible from the kettle spout.
The kettle has finished boiling. The tea bag, still in its wrapper, is placed inside the empty cup. The kettle is positioned to pour.
Hot water from the kettle has been poured into the cup, fully submerging the tea bag. The tea is steeping, and the water is turning a light brown color. Steam is rising from the cup.
The tea bag has been removed from the cup. The cup is filled with hot, dark brown tea, ready to drink. The kettle is empty and unplugged.

actions.description: Fill the kettle with water and plug it into the electrical outlet to boil the water.
Place the tea bag in the cup and position the boiled kettle for pouring.
Pour the hot water from the kettle into the cup, fully submerging the tea bag to steep.
Remove the tea bag from the cup, leaving the hot tea ready to drink.
